title: General election odds and poll tracker: Who would win, and will it happen in 2019?
text:
The chances of a snap election this year are back on the rise with a motion to hold a general election in December set to be held later today and Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn indicating that he will back it.

On Monday Prime Minister Boris Johnson failed with a similar vote to hold a snap election on Dec 12. Under the Fixed Terms Parliament Act, Mr Johnson required the support of two-thirds of MPs which he failed to achieve.

However following a meeting of the Shadow Cabinet, Mr Corbyn said that as a result of the EU agreeing to an extension of Article 50 "our condition of taking No Deal off the table has now been met", and indicated his willingness to back today's vote.

It comes after a Number...
description: The chances of a snap election this year are back on the rise with a motion to hold a general election in December set to be held later today and Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn indicating that he will back it.
